title: White House vows to appeal after judge sides with Harvard and reverses billions in Trump cuts – live
summary: A spokesperson criticized an "activist judge" following a ruling that deemed the administration's cuts to university research as illegal retaliation. The judge's decision highlights concerns over the government's handling of academic funding. The administration's actions have sparked controversy regarding the independence of educational institutions.

title: Australia politics live: Nationals cross floor to back Pauline Hanson motion on immigration; Bob Carr defends China visit
summary: Please provide the news article or details you'd like summarized, and I'll be happy to help!

title: Yiyun Li and Barbara Demick among writers longlisted for Baillie Gifford prize
summary: Twelve finalists have been announced for this year's £50,000 nonfiction prize. Among the contenders are notable authors Lyse Doucet, Justin Marozzi, Frances Wilson, Adam LeBor, and Jason Burke from the Guardian. The competition highlights a diverse range of nonfiction works.

title: From a spruced-up Big Ben to Cambridge’s crystal doughnut – Stirling prize for architecture shortlist unveiled
summary: Six finalists have been announced for a prestigious UK architecture award, featuring two houses, a medical research centre, and a college of fashion. Notably, there are no contenders from areas north of the Fens. The competition highlights a diverse range of architectural achievements.

title: Women’s Super League 2025-26 previews No 11: Tottenham
summary: The Spurs aim to recover from a disappointing 2024-25 season by appointing Martin Ho as their new manager. The team hopes his leadership will improve their performance. Fans are eager to see how this change will impact the upcoming season.
